doc.field: Another victim of Bad Reichenhall shooting

After a 16-year-old ran amok in Bad Reichenhall yesterday, a fifth victim, a 59-year-old man, died of his serious shot wounds in a Salzburg hospital today. Yesterday, the youth shot dead two neighbours and injured several passers-by. After running amok, the young man killed his sister, 18, with five shots and then himself. The police are still unclear about the motive.

Starting his three-day official visit of China, German Chancellor Gerhard Schroeder has arrived in the harbour city Shanghai. There, he is going to visit the sites of German companies. Thursday, Schroeder will continue to Beijing where he will meet members of the Chinese government. The Chancellor arrived from Japan where he had suggested including China in the medium-term in the group of leading industrial countries. The group, also known as the G8 countries, comprises currently eight countries.

Almost four years after the fire attack on an asylum seekers' home in Luebeck, Schleswig-Holstein, the Lebanese Safwan Eid has been acquitted again in after an appeal. Even after an evaluation of phone tap records that had not been used so far, the Kiel Regional Court did not find any evidence that the 23-year-old was guilty. In January 1996 ten people died and 38 were injured in the fire.
USA demand higher compensation for NS forced labourers

In the negotiations for the compensation of former Nazi forced labourers, the USA have called on both sides to make concessions. Commissioner Bindenagel said in Washington that he expected Germany to raise its offer of 6 billion DM. At the same time, the representatives of the Nazi victims should show some flexibility.
North German states want closer collaboration

The five North German states want to collaborate more closely and so form a counterweight to the Southern states. This was announced by the five social democratic heads of state of Hamburg, Lower Saxony, Bremen, Schleswig-Holstein and Mecklenburg-Vorpommern. During their meeting in Luebeck, they decided that in future the North German states should form a united front in parliament. Apart from that, traffic projects will be organised jointly. The Northern states plan to appear together at international trade fairs as well.
Arrest warrant against 19-year-old suspect for triple murder

The Koblenz state court has issued an arrest warrant for a 19-year-old for a triple murder. The young man is said to have murdered his parents and sister. He has already confessed to killing his parents with a knife and an axe in Urbar, near Koblenz, last week. He also confessed to disposing of his sister's body, but blamed her death on his father. The Koblenz police has not, as yet, been able to establish a motive. According to their investigations so far, the family concerned was a completely inconspicuous one.
More drug related deaths in Baden-Wuerttemberg

In Baden-Wuerttemberg the number of drug related deaths is increasing. Information gathered by the Schwarzwalder newspaper states that in the first ten months of this year, 228 people died of as a result of their addiction. According to the newspaper that is 57 more drug deaths, than in the same time-frame last year in Baden-Wuerttemberg. The state capital, Stuttgart, has contributed considerably to the negative trend.
Soccer: Wolfsburg in 3rd round of UEFA Cup
Wolfsburg has reached the 3rd round of the UEFA Cup by playing the Netherlands team Kerkrade 1-0.
